gallery_title: Game of Thrones - House Targaryen and Friends
description_html:
This gallery contains images of the personalities of the main members of House Targaryen from the show Game of Thrones. Click on one of the images on this page to see a full-sized image on its own page.

GoT: The Big Picture

There are dozens of characters in Game of Thrones. Sadly, this site cannot do justice to the vast number of relationships in the show because it is designed for presenting individual images.

Fortunately there are two Visualizing Game of Thrones Personalities books available. To learn more about these books, click on SEE THE STORY!
story_html:
The large number of characters on Game of Thrones gives fans of the show the opportunity to see patterns in personalities. For example, out of 42 characters, I found 10 ESTJs and 8 ISTJs, but only 1 ENFJ (Melisandre) and 1 INFJ (Daenerys). Hmmm, interesting!

Two editions of the book Visualizing Game of Thrones Personalities (VGoTP) are available:

  • VGoTP Mini-ebook Edition — less content and best for phones, 89 pages
  • VGoTP Full Edition: From Ned and Cersei to Tyrion and Daenerys — best for larger screens, 171 pages

Both books begin with a chapter looking at each of the Houses, then go on to include a chapter that compares and contrasts both similar and dissimlar Pairs of people. Following that is a chapter examining Groups of similar personalities, and both editions also include a Character Index and a list of Characters and Their Types at the end.

Additionally, the Full Edition includes an extra chapter offering Insights into some patterns of relationships. Ultimately the Full Edition includes close to twice as much information as the Mini-ebook Edition.

Click one of the links above to get your Visualizing Game of Thrones Personalities book today!

image_list.title: Viserys Targaryen
image_list.subtitle_html: Only Surviving Son of The Mad King Aerys Targaryen
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Viserys' spiritual portrait shows he is cold, ambitious, and pragmatic.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Viserys' dominant personality trait, his cold objectivity.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  Viserys shows how cold he can be when he sells his sister Daenerys to Khal Drogo for the support of the Dothraki in his pursuit of the Iron Throne.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Viserys' auxiliary personality trait, his short-sightedness.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  Viserys shows how short-sighted he is when he gets drunk and threatens Daenerys and her unborn son.

image_list.title: Daenerys Targaryen
image_list.subtitle_html: Daughter of The Mad King Aerys Targaryen
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Daenerys' spiritual portrait shows she is warm, ambitious, and idealistic.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Daenerys' dominant personality trait, her idealism and hope for the future.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  Freeing slaves is one way Daenerys shows she is idealistic.
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Daenerys' auxiliary personality trait, her warmth and compassion.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  Daenerys shows her compassion in the love she has for her dragons.

image_list.title: Missandei
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Missandei's spiritual portrait shows she is warm, easy-going, and pragmatic.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Missandei's dominant personality trait, her warmth and compassion.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  She shows her warmth when she talks to Grey Worm and shows compassion by listening to him discuss his harsh background at the hands of the slavemasters.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Missandei's auxiliary personality trait, her realism and openness to new experiences.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  She shows her realism when counseling Daenerys about the realities of slavery.

image_list.title: Grey Worm
image_list.subtitle_html: Commander of Daenerys' Army of Unsullied
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Grey Worm's spiritual portrait shows he is determined, inflexible, and realistic.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Grey Worm's dominant personality trait, his pragmatism.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  Grey Worm demonstrates his realism when he tells Missandei how he became a member of the Unsullied Army.
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Grey Worm's auxiliary personality trait, his objectivity and ability to remain cool-headed when fighting.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  Grey Worm's objectivity is evident in how he never shows any emotion.
